children.subject: When I was a tutor, my taxes were deducted beforehand

history.content:
Beforehand.

-----

A withholding tax is deducted from your pay. Whether or not you will need to make an additional payment afterwards will vary. (For example, I've had to, but that's because I also had financial aid.)

The tax form you fill out should be Form 1040NR (or the variant 1040NR-EZ), like everyone else.

You'll likely find it more convenient to use some (free) tax software / website to help you figure what forms you'll need though.

-----

Seems that TA Salaries are not subject to taxation: the W-4 I got said I paid no tax, and when I reported this information to both Federal tax and State tax, none of the two agencies require me to pay anything further. You should still definitely report your tax, though.

Beforehand.

-----

A withholding tax is deducted from your pay. Whether or not you will need to make an additional payment afterwards will vary. (For example, I've had to, but that's because I also had financial aid.)

The tax form you fill out should be Form 1040NR (or the variant 1040NR-EZ), like everyone else.

You'll likely find it more convenient to use some (free) tax software / website to help you figure what forms you'll need though.

Beforehand.

-----

A withholding tax is deducted from your pay. Whether or not you will need to make an additional payment afterwards will vary. (For example, I've had to, but that's because I also had financial aid.)

The tax form you fill out should be Form 1040 (or one of the variants, e.g. 1040A), like everyone else.

You'll likely find it more convenient to use some (free) tax software / website to help you figure what forms you'll need though.

children.subject:
It sounds like that's one of the tax websites (that's focused on non-residents) that I suggested?

That's certainly an option (and it seems like one that Berkeley's international office recommends / has paid for). Like other tax software, it's not necessary though; it just helps you fill out the actual tax forms.
Shouldn't international students fill in the online Glacier tax forms?

That's right. I was 8-hour TA so the total pay is less than that.

I did have another internship that pays more than $6300 though.

Shrug; don't feel like looking at tax tables right now.

As a 20-hour TA, I had several hundred dollars withheld from my pay (for both federal + state taxes) every month last year; TA salaries are definitely taxed.

Davis: Was your total pay less than $6300 (or however large your deductions were)?

Someone who is an 8-hour TA for a single semester with no other income, for example, won't get paid enough to be taxed, and possibly won't have any tax withheld either...? (I never bothered figuring out how withholdings are calculated.)

history.content: I'm a first time international student who's a TA. How do taxes work for us? I'm not sure what forms I need to fill out. Will I need to pay taxes later or will they be deducted from my payment beforehand?
history.subject: TA Taxes
